Authors:
Yao Wang, Yan-Fang Liu, De-Xiang Tang, Yuan-Bing Wang,
Alison E. M. Adams, Hong Yu
Title:
Two Tolypocladium species isolated from the same specimen of
naturally occurring Ophiocordyceps sinensis：Tolypocladium
reniformisporum sp. nov. and Tolypocladium cylindrosporum
(Ophiocordycipitaceae, Hypocreales)
Abstract:
Two Tolypocladium species, Tolypocladium reniformisporum
sp. nov., and T. cylindrosporum isolated from the same specimen of
naturally occurring Ophiocordyceps sinensis in the Baima Snow Mountains,
were described and illustrated by morphological and molecular
phylogenetic characters and growth-temperature relationships.
Phylogenetic analyses based on 5-gene (nrSSU, nrLSU, tef-1α, rpb1, and
rpb2) and internal transcribed spacer (ITS) data showed that T.
reniformisporum is close to T. cylindrosporum and other similar species.
However, T. reniformisporum morphologically differs from T.
cylindrosporum due its slower growing colonies, shorter conidiogenous
cells and smaller reniform conidia. Growth tests showed that T.
reniformisporum and T. cylindrosporum are psychrotrophic fungi, with
optimal growth temperatures of 2022 ℃, and minimum growth temperatures
below 5 ℃.
